content: Yes, many social media platforms have already implemented some of these measures. For example, Facebook has a reporting system where users can report any abusive content, and it also provides resources and support for victims of cyberbullying. Twitter has also taken steps to prevent cyberbullying, such as developing a filter that can detect abusive content and hiding it from users. Instagram has a feature that allows users to filter out offensive comments, and it has also launched an AI-based tool to detect bullying in photos and their captions. In addition, Snapchat, TikTok, and YouTube have implemented measures to prevent and combat cyberbullying as well.
